awd_titl_txt: International Postdoctoral Fellows Program:  Topics in the  Model Theory of p-adic Fields
awd_abstract_narration: 9505544  Haskell      The International Junior Investigator and Postdoctoral  Fellows Program enables U.S. scientists and engineers to  conduct three to twenty-four months of research abroad. The  program's awards provide opportunities for joint research,  and the use of unique or complementary facilities, expertise  and experimental conditions abroad.    This award will support a ten-month postdoctoral research  visit by Dr. Deirdre Haskell to work with Dr. Zoe Maria  Chatzidakis at the University of Paris.  This research concerns topics in the model theory of p-adic  fields.  Dr. Haskell wants to undertake two projects.  The  first concerns the model theory of algebraically closed  fields with an automorphism.  The second concerns the recent  proof by A. Wilkie of the model-completeness of real closed  fields with exponentiation.  Dr. Haskell would pursue  analogues of their results for formal power series over  valued fields. ***
org_div_long_name: Office of International Science and Engineering
